text: I never played this game when it originally came out, but they recently re-released it on the Switch as Grandia I and II. I got it and I love every minute of it. I am still playing through the first game. I'll start on the second as soon as I beat the first game. The quality of RPGs has gone way down as of late. They need to bring back these masterpieces. The watered-down RPGs they have today will make me lose all interest in the genre.
author: DarkAnimeCommander Soto

author: Tony Locke

text: Everytime I hear this theme song I get goosebumps! I'm re-playing this game! Man..such an awesome game! lol
author: Christopher Collects

text: I don't know how Noriyuki Iwadare was able to fit that guitar riff in there with a straight face. It's so cheesy that it somehow transcended even 'awesome'. Words cannot describe how much this song alone has affected my life. My hat's off to you, Iwadare, the most 'underrated' video game composer of all time!
author: Mandrakos

text: That violin opening, reaching it's climax at 0:08, is a masterpiece itself! :O
author: Saibanchou

text: This music makes me teary eyed just listening to it. Maybe it's silly, but the atmosphere of this game, and just how it was back when i first picked it was -amazing-. I am not ashamed to say, it's the first game i ever played that made me cry, and I'm sure most people know what i'm talking about :).

text: A long time ago, I modded my Wii so that a loopable version of this song played while I fought on Toon Link's Pirate Ship stage. Noriyuki Iwadare did contribute to Smash Bros. Brawl too... it would have been glorious if this song had appeared in this game... then a lot of entry-level gamers would have the opportunity to appreciate such a masterpiece.
